scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
MIME is included in 3 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to the Netherlands, Spain and Sweden. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets. 
 
CAMSS List of standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

National Interoperability Framework Observatory:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

The Netherlands Catalogue:
https://www.forumstandaardisatie.nl/open-standaarden/lijst

Spain Catalogue:
https://administracionelectronica.gob.es/pae_Home/pae_Estrategias/pae_Interoperabilidad_Inicio/pae_Normas_tecnicas_de_interoperabilidad.html#CATALOGOESTANDARES

Sweden Catalogue:
http://www.avropa.se/dynamiska-sidor/sok/?query=standards&searchtype=web

criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The purpose of MIME is not related to the publication of public data as open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:   
https://5stardata.info/en/

criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
IETF has a formal review and approval so that all the relevant stakeholders can formally appeal or raise objections to the development and approval of specifications.
Each distinct version of an Internet standards-related specification is published as part of the "Request for Comments" (RFC) document series. This archival series is the official publication channel for Internet standards documents and other publications.
During the development of a specification, draft versions of the document are made available for informal review and comment by placing them in the IETF's "Internet-Drafts" directory, which is replicated on a number of Internet hosts. This makes an evolving working document readily available to a wide audience, facilitating the process of review and revision.

Standard process IETF:
https://www.ietf.org/standards/process/ 

Internet Best Current Practices IETF:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2026

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
Like all the IETF standards, MIME is a free and open technical specification, built on IETF standards and licenses from the Open Web Foundation. Therefore, MIME is licensed on a royalty-free basis.
No IPR disclosures have been submitted directly on the MIME specification (RFC 2045).

Intellectual Property Rights in IETF:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3668

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification was developed in 1991 by the IETF group, and it has become a widely used format for the transaction of different types of files over the internet. It is focused on the transfer via email, and it is supported by numerous mail software. This fact demonstrates the maturity of MIME for its use for the development of services and products.

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification is widely adopted amongst others like SMTP for the exchange of data over the internet. It allows sharing several file formats, which makes the specification highly reusable. The specification has been implemented and it is supported by numerous mail software as Mailchimp amongst others, demonstrating the market acceptance of MIME.

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
Although at the moment of elaborating the assessment the specification is widely used, the specification in itself does not give any innovative solution that can be part of an innovative cutting edge solution.

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

Developer community IETF: 
https://www.ietf.org/about/

criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
As a mail format specification, MIME is a valuable tool for sharing information through the internet between administrations and stakeholders. It allows sharing data and information in a specific format, it fosters the visibility of administration data and services. MIME fosters the collaboration between public administrations and it eases the decision-making process of institutions.

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

statement:

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
As a specification that aim to allow and stablish exchange of documents, MIME can be used for the exchange of documents solving administrative burden. Additionally, it can avoid the exchange of non-digital documents that are generally a source of administrative burden.

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

statement:
MIME is being used to specify the media types supported by the Europeana collections. Europeana is a cultural initiative that works towards the preservation of the patrimonial heritage. 

Europeana Media Types: 
https://pro.europeana.eu/about-us/mission

https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After being evaluated compliant with the regulation on standardisation 1025/2012, MIME has been identified by Commission Implementing Decision and included in the European list of ICT Standards for e-procurement.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
The rules on European standardisation allow the European Commission to identify information and communication technology (ICT) technical specifications - that are not national, European or international standards - to be eligible for referencing in public procurement. This allows public authorities to make use of the full range of specifications when buying IT hardware, software and services, allowing for more competition in the field and reducing the risk of lock-in to proprietary systems.

After being evaluated compliant with the regulation on standardisation 1025/2012, MIME has been identified by Commission Implementing Decision. During the evaluation process, all the Member States are invited to share their doubts. The positive evaluation of MIME and its identification is considered an interoperability agreement.

ICT Standards for Procurement:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
The rules on European standardisation allow the European Commission to identify information and communication technology (ICT) technical specifications - that are not national, European or international standards - to be eligible for referencing in public procurement. This allows public authorities to make use of the full range of specifications when buying IT hardware, software and services, allowing for more competition in the field and reducing the risk of lock-in to proprietary systems. After being evaluated compliant with the regulation on standardisation 1025/2012, MIME has been identified by Commission Implementing Decision.

ICT Standards for Procurement: 
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of MIME is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of MIME is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
MIME does not define a common reusable data model, it is a standard mail format for the exchange of data.

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
The purpose of MIME is not related to the publication of public data as linked open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

MIME reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045
